Reviews.Title: “Had to stay for two weeks great place.”
Reviews.Author: MountainCraze12
Reviews.Content: This truly is a great place to stay for extended periods of time. The evening reception is enough to make a meal out of and it's free. The pool is way to small and is dirty. The staff here is excellent and friendly. They also keep your. Security in mind. GREAT PLACE TO STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: KJW2011
Reviews.Content: I always stay in the suite hotels if possible..Staybridge, Homewood, etc. This particular Staybridge was very nice. We had Rm 116..a one bedroom. The living area had a nice layout (sometimes they seem cramped a bit), The sofa was very nice - not worn at all. Double sinks in the vanity area. Very nice pool area and a decent breakfast. Good location of hotel. This one (at least our room) I would absolutely recommend to someone traveling. If you want to be right downtown however...this is North of there but we preferred it...still not far to go where ever you needed to despite the amount of construction going on in Dallas right now.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Duane W
Reviews.Content: I am taking time out of my busy schedule to write a positive review for this specific hotel because they earned it. I stayed at the suites for 10 days, so my assessment of the property and staff was ongoing. I can't say enough about Antonio (sp. ??), Allen, and GiGi. GiGi is the manager and went out of her way to make my stay better than average. Anyway, if I ever return to Dallas, this hotel has earmed my future business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shutterbugblues
Reviews.Content: Good service. Good food. Good staff. I stay here a lot and it is always nice and clean. Would recommend this to family and co-workers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Short or Log Term”
Reviews.Author: Gilles B
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, Friendly, and have a wonderful breakfast everyday. Fruits, cereals, bacon and Eggs etc. I would certainly recommend. Pet friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “Added Staybridge to my list of good places to stay.”
Reviews.Author: PatTilley
Reviews.Content: This is an all suite hotel. The suites are roomy and well laid out. I stayed there for two weeks and had two different rooms. One overlooking the pool area for a week and one overlooking the rear parking lot and residential neighborhood for a week. Most evenings they have buffet-like spread in the lobby for guests that has enough food you can actually enjoy your evening meal there. They also a free breakfast spread that is not all carbs. like most hotels. For long term guests the housekeeping staff visit the room each day for a light cleaning and towel replacement if necessary with a heavier cleaning once a week and do a very good job. The hotel is far enough off the road and freeway that traffic noise is no problem. The elevators and ice machines are quiet too. There is a chain drug store across the parking lot that has a good variety of convenience food albeit rather expensive. There are several eating places within walking distance. The desk people were very accommodating and helpful. I forgot my corporate ID and in order to get the corporate rate I needed to show it. The fellow on the desk watched me sign in to my company's Virtual Private Network on my laptop and accepted that as corporate ID.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business! Also pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Jcw423
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great rooms, excellent amenities. They treat you like you are family!

Reviews.Title: “Very homely”
Reviews.Author: Bfs84
Reviews.Content: They do have a full kitchen with the exception of a stove and my wife and I took advantage of it. We got groceries and just slept in and chilled. They have a DVD, VCR combo in the room and the redbox at CVS is literally walking distance. The hotel is a great location between downtown and six flags. There is also an arcade with go carts 5 miles away. The absolute best bang for your buck especially if you have kids. They also have 2 outside gas grills next to the pool and jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Pet-friendly, salvation after the mover's departed.”
Reviews.Author: Volumnia
Reviews.Content: Stay with my Mum after the mover's picked up my things for an out-of-state move. Excellent check-in: generous, attentive desk staff. Room was exceptionally clean and comfortable. Bed and suite furniture was not brand-new, but it was in good repair, clean and we both slept very well. Free laundry facilities! Very quiet. Just far enough from I-635 that we heard no noise. It was a great place to get ourselves organized for a move to another state. We stayed over the weekend, the hotel was busy, but not crowded. Looks like there might be much more business traffic during the weekdays. Great price. Neighborhood isn't the greatest, but it's not scary. Easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “A superb stay at staybridge near the galleria”
Reviews.Author: PJorden
Reviews.Content: A great Hotel, was greeted by staff on reception who are lovely and freindly, was located on second floor easy to get to, the room was WOW massive room like an apartment, big living room with comfy sofa TV and nice desk to work from with wired and wireless internet, kitchen area was good cooker, massive fridge & freezer, combined microwave and cooker, also dish washer, bedroom was lovely and with TV so you lounge in living room or bedroom the bathroom was big too, wich went then into toilet and bath and shower, lovely view of the swimming pool, and the pool area is great, room, hotel and pool spotless, three nights in restaurant they have meals from 5.30-7.30, breakfast too was lovely each morning that set you for the day, shuttle bus that tok you 3-4 miles from hotel take you to the gorgeous Galleria shopping mall, or up the road 2miles to supermarket able to get all food to cook in kitchen if you want, also 2min walk from hotel is CVS pharmercy, huge and wide selection of everything you need, and also local deli and takeaway foods, 4-5 of these to choose burgers subs sandwiches, or walk across from hotel to other hotel crown plaza eat in the restaurant there selcetion of meals and a bar, shuttle bus operates mon - fri til 7, after that a cab can take you for $20 to other local area for food, al in all a superb hotel, lovely staff and manager, will be going back in september 2011 and staying and recommend to all to stay a lovely hotel :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family on a budget”
Reviews.Author: sugar32
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a lot of perks for families traveling on a budget. The breakfast buffet and evening receptions (Mon. - Thur.) we wonderful and saved us a ton on food. We brought our dog with us and the hotel was very pet friendly. The cleaning staff was also very diligent and our room never went a day without being serviced, even when we didn't remove the "do not disturb" sign until 3pm. The fitness center was a big plus too. The only downside I'd give to the hotel is that the walls are kind of thin and you can hear everything in the hallway and that the internet was a little slow. But as far as hotels go, I think those things are minor. We will be staying at this hotel again when we are in the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Smlygirl98
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend and had a wonderful visit. The room was very clean and the bed was so comfortable. The staff was very friendly. We stay in the king one bedroom suite. When we come back to Dallas we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Rooms, and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: tdamexia
Reviews.Content: Traveling quite a bit in my job I get to experience the good, the bad and the ugly. Staybridge Suites impressed me from the moment I walked in the door. The staff was friendly and helpful. My extended stay is very nice because they go the extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trip12345
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel and not a typical Staybridge design. However, it is clean and well maintained. Nice breakfast and happy hour in the week. Nice looking pool, although not heated. There is a jacuzzi though. A great rate and near the Galleria mall. Would stay again if the rate is right.

Reviews.Title: “Premire Lodging”
Reviews.Author: ejmmorris
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this property due to having a child in "Dallas Medical City" "Children's Hospital. This stay was a difficult stay due to the hospital time and the fact that my wife had just had cancer surgery. Being the chemotheraphy has taken it's toll she was unable to leave the bed in the hotel The staff and the housekeeping team were beyond excellant, as was the time before. We , especially my wife, were made to be very comfortable. The food sevice as well was, like before, above and beyond in quality and presentation. Your team there do an excellant job. Very courtious and accomodating. As far as changing any thing..., just strive to keep it as is. We wouldn't consider another hotel so long as it is in the area of our needs. "Blesssings..., "Ed Jeanne & "Maria Morris

Reviews.Title: “This time my family experience was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kivanc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel once again last weekend. This time everyhting was perfect . There was no noisy at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but No A/C”
Reviews.Author: DenverG_10
Reviews.Content: Great Place. We had a 2 bedroom suite (which is hard to find) that included a King bed, 2 double beds, and a pull-out sofa. It fit our family very well. Unfortunitly only the second bedroom had A/C as the A/C was out in the rest of the suite. We did not check into the room until late and did not notice it until the next morning when it started to get hot in the room. We were leaving anyway so it worked out and we were comped 10% off of our room. The breakfast area is nice as well as the pool. Service is great.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: aby8915
Reviews.Content: I visited this Hotel in July 2008. when I was on a business visit to Dallas, As far as my opinion is concerned this is the best place to stay, The ambience is very cool, The food is very good, Hotel staff is very co operative, friendly, and helpful, and away from the city noise and traffic, and not to forget - the cleaniness in the Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay with”
Reviews.Author: RAJTH85
Reviews.Content: It has good spacious rooms with got facilities combined with great services. Also they serve good breakfast and also the swimming pool there is good.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Kivanc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Staybridge hotels before. So I preferred staybridge hotel. I had paid hotel price in advance 1 month ago. When I checked in this staybridge suite dallas near the galleria, on feb 19, they asked me my credit card for possible things.Same day, I noticed my credit card was charged with double price of the payment I had paid before. And my credit card was blocked. Then I asked why, they told me that it was a problem in their system and they apologized. They told me that they would release.(Still I am waiting for them) And moreover, I noticed that they charged me a daily video price which I didn't watch. Then they apologized again. Moreover there was a noisy in the hole during the night.

Reviews.Title: “This place was a great place to stay while visiting the Texas State Fair”
Reviews.Author: StaffordBrave
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quiet. They provided a good breakfast and a comfortable room for our long weekend in the Dallas area to enjoy the Texas State Fair. The people at the front desk were very helpful. They told us that we should travel a short distance to the Forrest Lane DART station and use public transportation to get to the fair. When we mentioned about our disappointment at the aquarium in the fair being closed for renovation they told us about the Dallas World Aquarium which could also be reached using the same public transportation. The DART rail saved us money on parking at the fair. It also saved us a long walk through the parking lots.

Reviews.Title: “Older Property with Some Positive and Negative Features”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviewer333
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on a business trip in Dallas, and chose based on largely positive reviews here. There is some very good, and some bad with this hotel - the saying that you get what you pay for really rings true here. This Staybridge is relatively cheap as compared to other hotels in this area because it is an older Staybridge, on the fringe of a neighborhood that seems to be not very safe - based on the police I saw coming into the manager's office and asking "how things have been here." The decor is fine but seems very 80s. I laugh at the title of "near the Galleria" - it is actually about 3 miles drive from the mall. One thing that really made me think negatively of the hotel is that you have to go up a small flight of stairs to get to the elevator - unbelievable for any hotel of it's kind. You can avoid the flight (about 5 steps), but you have go all the way around the property - it made me think that handicapped persons or those who need extra assistance to get to their rooms could have a problem here. Also, there were several very annoying and antogonizing stray cats around one of the side entrances - that wanted to come into the hotel and also jump into your car if you left the door open! I stayed on the top floor as usual, but noted a strong smell of cigarette smoke in the hall, but not in the room. What made the stay positive was the very helpful front desk staff, who really deserve a gold star for their friendliness and helpfulness, not the least of which included not charging me for a multiple page, long distance fax I needed to send. Would I stay here again? Maybe/maybe not,. There other choices in the area, although you will pay more for most of them.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Texas George
Reviews.Content: Three story facility with security doors, pool, BBQ area laundry, day room, internet, free computer and breakfast. Located just off of the loop just a few miles east of I 35. The Good: Staff went out of teir way to accomodate. Stayed two nights and each day departed before the 7 am breakfast. Staff made sure cont breakfast was available prior to dearture. Hotel and grounds were spotless. Never saw cleaning staff and room was always clean. Starbucks,CV (?) Pharmacy, hamburger an sanwich shop adjacent to property. Full kitchen. Extra storage space for your gear inside of the hotel The bad: Well not really, but there was a house with burgler bars next to the property. Parking areas well lit and no security threats noted. Will need to drive to most restaurants. The Ugly: none noted. Summary: Stay with pleasure. Easy freeway access yet no freeway noise. If the hotel is dog friendly (?) lot's of area to walk. Rooms were spacious and updaed tv's. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: cyyoungcear
Reviews.Content: The hotel isn't perfect, you might find a small chip on a bedside table, or maybe there's a door handle that's a little loose, but overall the hotel is WONDERFUL. It has an amazing style, it practically looks like a house from the outside and the rooms inside match that. The rooms are basically fully furnished apartments, and the decor makes them feel very much like home, I've never felt so comfortable inside a hotel. The room itself provides you with anything you could ever need from a toaster, dishwasher, dishwashing liquid, stove, pots and pans, cooking utensils, silverware, a full size fridge, not one of those mini-fridges(I love ice cream, and mini-fridges fail at keeping your ice cream frozen). And even though the rooms are great, the service is what will keep you coming back. Eveeryone at the desk is an absolute delight, Allen, Ron, and Terry are the most kind, professional, and caring people I've ever seen at a hotel desk and you could not ask for more helpful people. And I think this stems from the manager, Gina, who is incredibly kind. She actually won Manager of the Year for 2006 of ALL Intercontinental Hotels Group Hotels, and that includes Holiday Inn, Holiday Inn Express, Crowne Plaza, Hotel Indigo, Candlewood Suites, Staybridge Suites, and Intercontinental Hotels. The helpfulness of everyone on her staff shows why she won this award. I was truly blown away. Finally, they offer a great breakfast bar, and Tuesday through Thursday they offer a wonderful reception in the evenings, so it's like they feed you while you stay as well. I love this hotel, and if ever I'm in Dallas again, I'm staying here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “No Housekeeping on Christmas Day”
Reviews.Author: fnovends
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 days at this hotel during Christmas 2008. I was disappointed by the housekeeping service they provided. First off, the housekeeping lady did not replenish the coffee, popcorn that supposed to be in the little caddie. I finally left a note to remind her the 3rd day. She refilled the caddie up the next day. Our kids finished the popcorn and we made a pot of coffee a day later, and run the dishwasher. You would think she would have be a little bit more cognizant about that little caddie and checking the cleaning supplies. No, she did not refill the caddie, again. That was our 6th day. I finally give up on her. So for the rest of our stay, I just go down to the hall to get a cup of coffee. Secondly, our rooms were not made and fresh towels were not provided on Christmas Day. Is that their policy that no housekeeping on Christmas Day? I even noticed the little crumps my kids left behind was still there on the day we left!! On the positive notes, the rooms are big and beds are comfy. Breakfast is just fine. We are making another trip in 3 months. I guess I will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Family Gathering!”
Reviews.Author: Illinois_John
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from the 2nd through 4th of July. We used a one bedroom suite, and 2 two bedroom suites for the 11 of us who were there. This hotel was excellent for our family gathering. The two bedroom suites were wonderful for the families with children. Also, the common area in the two bedroom suite was large enough for the family to gather, work on jigsaw puzzles, and just talk. While the internet went down for the last day of our stay, it was great to have this wireless access in the rooms. The pool area was nice to sit around and relax. It is enclosed within the hotel buiding, so is very private. The pool itself was nice for the kids to play in. The breakfast buffet, which is included in the room rates, was very good. The fruit selection, as well as hot breakfast provided was wonderful. To our surprise, there was also a Happy Hour each afternoon (I believe only from Monday to Thursday) with free beer, wine, soft drinks, and some appetizers. All of the staff was very friendly from the front desk to the happy hour server. The sales manager even stopped by to see that everyone was having a good time during the happy hour. My wife tells me that it is 341 paces from the front lobby door to the entrance to Starbucks. There is also a CVS Pharmacy right next door for any of those small items you may need. All in all, this was a perfect setting for our family to get together for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Patticoke
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, this hotel is an EXCELLENT choice and value!! We spent a week there in a 2 bedroom suite. It was the BEST layout for our needs!! PERFECT!! I was impressed with the phone call to check on us after we arrived in our rooms. As I was with the front desk. For our needs, I don't think it could get any better. We were traveling with our daughter and she had a separate bedroom and bathroom. I liked the full sized refrigerator and coffee pot. Everything was very convenient. The wireless internet was good. They even had a dvd player, although we didn't use it. I definitely recommend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Staybridge Suites Dallas Near the Galleria
HotelInfo.Address: 7880 Alpha Road, Dallas, TX 75240
